Replies.Reply: Fella, what'd I tell ya? If you're not willing to give a little extra, Champion can't use you.
Is that all?
Hunh?
S'cuse me, Ezekiel.
Mr. Giacomo, when one of the white guys has come off a double shift and says he's too tired to work overtime, you don't fire him.
Drive to the trainyard, Easy!
I want my job back, Mr. Giacomo. I need to work and I need a good job.
Ezekiel, Mr. Giacomo.
Joppy, how much they payin' out there at McDonell Douglas?
How ya doin'?
Houston.
What kind of work you do?
Who the hell is that, Joppy?
What kinda business?
In other words, he's a gangster.
DeWitt Albright reminded me of somebody I knew back in Houston.
I'm here to see Mr. Albright.
I have an appointment -- I'm supposed to meet him.

Hey, man!    What's wrong with you?
Keep your hands to yourself. I don't let no man feel on me like that.
Your friends, hunh?
Sure.
Depends on what kind of job. I don't want to get mixed up in nothing.
She leave him?
I ain't never heard of her before.

I just have to tell you where she is?

Naw.    I got fired.

Boy, it's happenin' tonight.
Go on, man.
Alphonso Jenkins!

Sure.   Sure.

Daphne?

Write me and tell me when's a good time."

Hello?

Mr. Albright, is that you?
I got what you want.   She's with--

I wasn't used to going to white communities, like Malibu, to conduct business. Champion Aircraft was in Santa Monica but I drove out there in the daytime, did my work and came home. I never loitered nowhere except among my own people, in my own neighborhood.
Yeah.   It's all right.
The Gulf, they have the Gulf.
I think they're looking for you.
I don't want no trouble.

I don't kill children.
Yeah.
Where?

Yeah.

--Easy.
You'd do that?
No.    I can't do that.
I don't want no part of all this.
No dice.
Crazy assed broad!   What the hell are you doing?!

Daphne!
Hey, wait a minute!
Dammit!

Hunh?

Forget about it, operator.
That girl called me last night.
The one your friend is lookin' for.

Well, tell him Mr. Albright sent me, and it's real important.
Rawlins. But I'm not so sure he'd want me to tell you.

Yeah.   I'll take two hundred right now.

It was actually looking more and more like I might not make it through this little adventure I was having. But I was likin' the chill in my blood, and the freedom of working on my own.
There were times in the war when I had felt like this. When life or death where the only two choices.

Who killed her?
